title: Carrie F. Butler Thwing;
snippet: I have serious doubts whether the pleasant days at Edinburgh will be duplicated during our trip. We took rooms at the Cockburn House close to the station, and in walking to them the picturesque features of the old city burst upon us at once. At our right were the beautiful Princess gardens stretching down the ravine dividing the old city from the new until they meet the remarkable massive Greek stone buildings occupied by the Antiquarian Museum and the National Portrait Gallery.
